title: Baked Trout with Sage
summary: Baked Trout with Sage is a gluten free, primal, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. For $2.38 per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 283 calories, 0g of protein, and 18g of fat. If you have butter, wine, sage, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 17%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes include Trout with Sage, Sage-Crusted Trout, and Cornmeal-Fried Trout with Grapefruit and Fried Sage.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Preheat the oven to 450 F. Season the trout inside and out with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine the softened butter, sage, and parsley, and blend well. Divide the mixture into four equal parts, spread one portion inside each opened trout, and close the fish as you would a book. Rub a large baking dish with the olive oil, and arrange the trout comfortably within it. Add  cup of the wine and bake 10 minutes, basting occasionally and gradually adding the remaining wine to compensate for evaporation.                                                    Drain the liquid into a small nonreactive saucepan, and cover the trout to keep them warm. Boil the cooking liquid until emulsified and reduced, about 5 minutes. With a spatula, carefully transfer the fish to a serving platter or individual dishes, strain, and spoon the reduced sauce over them.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 450 F. Season the trout inside and out with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, combine the softened butter, sage, and parsley, and blend well. Divide the mixture into four equal parts, spread one portion inside each opened trout, and close the fish as you would a book. Rub a large baking dish with the olive oil, and arrange the trout comfortably within it.
Add  cup of the wine and bake 10 minutes, basting occasionally and gradually adding the remaining wine to compensate for evaporation.

Drain the liquid into a small nonreactive saucepan, and cover the trout to keep them warm. Boil the cooking liquid until emulsified and reduced, about 5 minutes. With a spatula, carefully transfer the fish to a serving platter or individual dishes, strain, and spoon the reduced sauce over them.
